title: CoverGirl's response to James Charles' racist tweet is incredibly cringe | Metro News
text:
Miranda Larbi for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 21 Feb 2017 11:27 am (Picture: Instagram/jcharlesbeauty) 
Everyone knows that when being accused of racism, the very last thing you should do is try and use the ‘friend defence’. 
It goes along the lines of: ‘I’m absolutely not being racist – I’ve got loads of (black/Asian/mixed etc.) friends. Hell, my best mate is a (black/Asian/mixed etc.) dude and his family all love me’. The woman who created 'on fleek' has launched a GoFundMe to start her own beauty line 
Plenty of people have told me in the past how they’re not a fan of mixed race marriages (something about white women stealing black men, yadda yadda) and would never want a biracial kid. And they’ve also always clarified that they’re not being racist because they love me . 
NEWS FLASH my friends: you are still a bit racist. 
Which is why people were confused when CoverGirl tried to use this line of argument when defending their first ever male model, James Charles. 
The 17-year-old recently found himself in a whole load of sh*t when he tweeted a bizarre ‘joke’ about Africa having ECbola. I will no longer support your company as long as he's on the campaign. This was stereotypical & degrading to Africa. @COVERGIRL @COVERGIRL pic.twitter.com/RpgMp1lqfg 
— IG/SC: ParisHeelton (@ImTheBombDotCom) February 16, 2017 
This, despite the fact that the World Health Organisation officially declaring that Africa was clear of Ebola as of January 2016. 
And rather than simply coming out and admitting that it was a dumb thing to say, CoverGirl didn’t make Charles apologise for the comment. 
Instead, they posted a photo of him hugging Zendaya – which they’ve since deleted. a play in four acts pic.twitter.com/eSCplXDN6W 
Because there’s no way he could be an ignorant t**t if he could hug a biracial model, right? 
The point wasn’t lost on Twitter. when covergirl really tried to tweet zendaya and james charles together after his messy statement pic.twitter.com/bVHt2LJZyi
